ThingDef.label: Domestic Cat
ThingDef.description: Fluffy balls of DEATH.

ThingDef.label: muffalo
ThingDef.description: A large herding herbivore descended from buffalo and adapted for some exotic environment. Peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: rhinoceros
ThingDef.description: This large land mammal is typically quite peaceful, but it will not hesitate to charge with its horn to fend off trespassers.

ThingDef.label: cobra
ThingDef.description: A large snake. Cobras can be highly aggressive if provoked - it's better to stay away from these creatures.

ThingDef.label: wild boar
ThingDef.description: Although considered impure by some cultures, this hairy ancestor of the domesticated pig is prized for the gamey flavor of its meat.

ThingDef.label: warg
ThingDef.description: Heavily-muscled wolf-like creatures. Scientists say wargs are the descendants of weaponized military animals created for population suppression. The superstitious see them as the tools of an angry god.

ThingDef.label: megascarab
ThingDef.description: A large, genetically-engineered beetle. Once the worker caste of an artifical ecosystem of insectoids designed to fight mechanoid invasions, it is now usually seen without its deadlier insectoid cousins. Still, its size and hard shell make it dangerous when it attacks. A eusocial creature, it cannot reproduce individually.

ThingDef.label: AlphaMuffalo
ThingDef.description: A huge Muffalo that has survived the harsh landscape of Rimworld, It's strength allows it to wander alone and spread its lineage to many herds of Muffalo. They can also be somewhat aggressive if you get too close.

ThingDef.label: buffalo
ThingDef.description: Muffalo cousin. Common in warm and forest areas. Is more aggressive than Muffalo.

ThingDef.label: Crashbug
ThingDef.description: These fearsome critters are small and hard to find, and they can often be fatal if one strikes. But they are very easy to kill once you find them. This is what earned them their name.

ThingDef.label: fly
ThingDef.description: What used to be a common housefly has grown to be a huge pest.

ThingDef.label: Furx
ThingDef.description: Furxes are only found in large numbers on the desolate Rimplanets, where the hunt for their luxurious furs isn't deemed worth the time and effort.

ThingDef.label: Lacosdile
ThingDef.description: Crossbred and genetically manipulated lizard originally created as part of clever fragrance marketing gig. Being herbivorous and barely dangerous made them very common pets. However as the trends passed Lacosdiles were soon found flooding the sewage systems and in desperation were carried off across the galaxy to the furthest reaches of space. As a result the species now flourish on the desolate rimworlds.

ThingDef.label: Megaslug
ThingDef.description: The possible result of genetic farming gone wrong. Nobody is certain how these creatures came to be, But it can be agreed that they're still very.. sluggish.

ThingDef.label: mosquito
ThingDef.description: Swarming parasites.

ThingDef.label: quadhog
ThingDef.description: This oversized cousin of the wild boar is four times as aggressive and four times as deadly. Luckily there aren't very many of them running around or life would be even harder than it already is on this remote rim world.

ThingDef.label: Rimdog
ThingDef.description: These friendly canines can be seen wandering around the wilderness in large packs. Some have even been known to wander into town and snag any food they can find lying around.

ThingDef.label: rimram
ThingDef.description: The thick wool on these rams makes them very common sight in cold climates, where the heat doesn't bother them so much. Known for their ability to stand at 90 degree angles on mountain walls.

ThingDef.label: Rimwolf
ThingDef.description: These intelligent creatures have evolved from the wild wolves of Earth which were released on this backwater planet long ago. They are fearsome predators and can quickly overpower large prey that carelessly lets itself get surrounded by them.

ThingDef.label: Snork
ThingDef.description: There's a distinct resemblance between Snorks and Walruses but it's impossible to tell which came first as lot of the datalogs of earthen fauna has been poorly kept and corrupted. Their tusks are very high demand luxury item.

ThingDef.label: spindlecrib
ThingDef.description: This is one very large arachnid. Unlike most giant bugs, these spiders have evolved this way, without the aid of gene manipulation. The name Spindlecrib was given to them in favour of 'Megaspider' after several recorded cases of the spiders dragging their victims in their lair, and keeping them alive for months on end, serving as a crib of sorts for their offspring.

ThingDef.label: tarantula
ThingDef.description: Eight legged monsters with hideous fangs!!

ThingDef.label: Hedgehog
ThingDef.description: A small spine covered mammal.

ThingDef.label: Bruiser-Hog
ThingDef.description: The result of ill-advised experiments into breeding genetically altered versions of the common hedgehog for meat. Bruiser-Hogs are extremely aggressive and very powerful.
